pages.text: Learn about Richey Suncoast Theatre, a historic non-profit performing arts venue in downtown New Port Richey. Discover our mission, community impact, and dedication to live theatre and cultural enrichment.

Join Richey Suncoast Theatre and help keep live theatre thriving in New Port Richey! Become a Member to enjoy exclusive perks, early ticket access, and special eventsâ€”all while supporting community arts and entertainment.
Have questions or need directions? Contact Richey Suncoast Theatre in downtown New Port Richey. View our box office hours, email, phone number, and location to plan your visit or get involved.

The historic Richey Suncoast Theatre offers community theatre and more in Downtown New Port Richey

September 19, 2025
7:00 PM
Rob Little - Live Comedy
Get ready, Richey Suncoast Theatreâ€”because pure optimism and BIG laughs are rolling into town!  On September 19, 2025, at 7 PM, the one and only Rob Little will hit the stage, bringing his signature high-energy stand-up and unstoppable good vibes!

He left a cushy job at IBM to follow his dreamâ€”and thank goodness he did! Named "The Happiest Comic in America" by NBCâ€™s Last Comic Standing, Rob has racked up comedy awards left and right, from College Comic of the Year to Maxim Magazineâ€™s Comedian of the Year!

Donâ€™t miss your chance to see this funniest, most progressive comedian LIVE! Grab your crew, snag your tickets, and get ready for a night of nonstop laughter thatâ€™ll leave you grinning ear to ear.

 Tickets are going fastâ€”book yours NOW!

FREEBIRD â€“ A Lynyrd Skynyrd Tribute
Richey Suncoast Theatre is thrilled to present FREEBIRD, the ultimate Lynyrd Skynyrd tribute band, for a one-night-only performance on Saturday, September 20, 2025. Showtime is 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM, with doors opening at 6:15 PM.

Formed in 2002, FREEBIRD has captivated audiences with their faithful recreations of Lynyrd Skynyrdâ€™s iconic live sound. â€œFrom the beginning, we felt the need to deliver the highest quality of music,â€ says lead singer Al Mazzone, who channels the soulful grit of Ronnie Van Zant.

With a six-member lineup featuring powerful vocals, blazing guitar solos, honky-tonk piano, and a driving rhythm section, FREEBIRD delivers hit after hitâ€”from â€œGimme Three Stepsâ€ to the unforgettable â€œFree Bird.â€ The band continues to sell out theaters and venues across the East Coast and is dedicated to honoring Skynyrdâ€™s musical legacy.

Oktoberfest: FREE Event
ğŸ‚ Experience Oktoberfest at Richey Suncoast Theatre ğŸ‚ 
Where global traditions meet local celebration!

ğŸ“… Sunday, September 21, 2025
 â° 2:00 â€“ 5:00 PM 
ğŸ“ Richey Suncoast Theatre, 
6237 Grand Blvd, 
New Port Richey, FL 34652 
ğŸ’² FREE Community Event

Step into a world of vibrant tradition as we bring the heart of Germany to downtown New Port Richey! Oktoberfest is more than beer and bratwurstâ€”itâ€™s a centuries-old celebration of music, dance, and togetherness thatâ€™s recognized around the globe.

Whether youâ€™ve never heard of Oktoberfest or youâ€™ve celebrated it your whole life, this is your chance to experience its magic right here at home. Enjoy live performances, authentic German folk dancing, and festive activities for all ages.

ğŸ¶ Why it matters: Richey Suncoast Theatre proudly celebrates cultures from around the worldâ€”because storytelling, tradition, and community belong to everyone. By honoring German heritage through Oktoberfest, we invite you to explore something new, connect with neighbors, and celebrate the diversity that makes our city shine.

Bring your friends, bring your curiosity, and be part of a cultural experience thatâ€™s joyful, welcoming, and unforgettable.

Sponsored by the City of New Port Richey 
This event is proudly supported by the City of New Port Richey, whose commitment to cultural celebration and community connection makes gatherings like this possible. Their partnership with Richey Suncoast Theatre brings global traditions to our local stageâ€”free and open to all.

A Haunted History of West Pasco with Historian Madonna Wise
Time Travel with a Twist! Join historian, genealogist & author Madonna Wise as she uncovers haunted folklore and ghostly 
legends from Pasco County's past. 
Paranormal investigator Nicole Ferro joins Madonna for a spine-tingling night of ghostly tales. 
History meets mysteryâ€”donâ€™t miss it!

October 3, 2025
7:00 PM
Dogma' 25th Anniversary Screening (One Night Only!)
Experience a cinematic resurrection! Join us for a special one-night-only screening of Kevin Smith's legendary 1999 comedy, Dogma, in honor of its 25th anniversary.

Long unavailable on streaming platforms and difficult to find on physical media, this cult classic is returning to the big screen. This is a must-see event for 90s movie fans, Gen X and Millennials who grew up on the View Askewniverse, and pop culture enthusiasts looking for a rare theatrical experience.

Featuring an incredible cast including Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Alan Rickman, Chris Rock, and of course, Jay & Silent Bob, Dogma is a bold, hilarious, and thought-provoking satire.

This exclusive showing is part of the Dogma Resurrection Tour hosted by Iconic Events. Donâ€™t miss your chance to see this film as it was meant to be seen. Tickets are limited, so secure your seat and prepare for a night of irreverent humor and nostalgia.
BUY TICKETS
October 4, 2025
7:00 PM
Homegrown: The Zac Brown Band Tribute Experience
Get ready to sing along to all your favorites! Homegrown, the ultimate Zac Brown Band tribute, is bringing their authentic Southern rock and country hits to the Richey Suncoast stage.

Based right here in Tampa, this incredible group delivers the most genuine Zac Brown Band experience in the U.S. You'll hear pitch-perfect harmonies, feel those toe-tapping rhythms, and join in on all your favorite sing-along anthems!

Don't miss your chance to hear "Chicken Fried," "Toes," "Colder Weather," and many more live!

A Little Hocus Pocus â€“ A Drag Tribute Show
Live at Richey Suncoast Theatre in New Port Richey!
Get bewitched by the ultimate Halloween show! A Little Hocus Pocus â€“ A Drag Tribute Show flies into the Richey Suncoast Theatre for one night only.

Join the Tampa Bay Sanderson Sistersâ€”your favorite local drag icons Kathryn Nevets, Daphne Ferraro, and Chi Chi LaLiqueâ€”for a dazzling theatrical tribute to Disneyâ€™s Hocus Pocus and Hocus Pocus 2. These three performers, all with deep roots in the New Port Richey and Tampa Bay area, have been thrilling audiences with this show for over a decade.

Experience the magic as they perform iconic scenes and high-energy musical numbers from the beloved films. This isn't just a drag show; it's a full-scale Halloween theatrical experience! Youâ€™ll also meet other fan favorites like Billy Butcherson, The Mayor, and Thackeray Binks.

This is a family-friendly event with no explicit content, but it does feature drag performance, so audience discretion is advised.

Donâ€™t miss your chance to see these local legends live! ğŸ§¹ A Bewitching Night of Music, Magic & Mayhem!

November 7, 2025
7:00 PM
Don McMillan: The Engineer of Comedy
Join us at Richey Suncoast Theatre in New Port Richey, Florida for an unforgettable night of live stand-up comedy with Don McMillan â€” the viral tech-savvy comedian known for turning PowerPoint slides into pure punchlines. A Top 12 Finalist on Americaâ€™s Got Talent, Don has been featured on The Tonight Show, Comedy Central, and Dry Bar Comedy.

With his engineering background and razor-sharp wit, Don delivers clean, high-energy comedy thatâ€™s perfect for professionals, tech enthusiasts, and anyone who loves smart humor. From office chaos and Zoom fatigue to AI jokes and dating app disasters, Donâ€™s show is a must-see for fans of clever, relatable stand-up.

November 14, 2025
7:00 PM
The Play That Goes Wrong
Get Your Tickets Now for The Play That Goes Wrong at Richey Suncoast Theatre!
Prepare for an unforgettable night of side-splitting laughter! The Tony Award-winning international comedy sensation, The Play That Goes Wrong, is bringing its hilarious mayhem to the Richey Suncoast Theatre. If you're looking for tickets to a comedy show in New Port Richey that promises non-stop laughs, this is it!

Experience the absolute chaos as the Cornley Polytechnic Drama Society attempts to put on a 1920s murder mystery. From collapsing sets and missed cues to hilariously botched lines and actors going off script, every theatrical disaster imaginable unfolds before your eyes. Itâ€™s a masterclass in physical comedy and impeccable comedic timing that will have you roaring with laughter from start to finish.

Why You Can't Miss The Play That Goes Wrong
Critically Acclaimed Comedy: This award-winning play has captivated audiences worldwide with its unique blend of farce, slapstick, and pure comedic genius.

Perfect for All Ages: Whether it's a fun night out with friends or a memorable date night, The Play That Goes Wrong guarantees an evening of pure, unadulterated fun for everyone.

See It Live in New Port Richey: Don't miss your chance to see this global hit right here at the Richey Suncoast Theatre.

Doors open 45 minutes prior to showtime; houses open 30 minutes prior to showtime.

Buy your tickets today for The Play That Goes Wrong at Richey Suncoast Theatre and get ready for a night of uncontrollable laughter. You'll be talking about this side-splitting comedy long after the curtain falls!

Directed by David Oâ€™Hara
Produced by John Sallustio
By Henry Lewis, Jonathan Sayer, and Henry Shields
Performed by Special Arrangement with Dramatists Play Service under license from Mischief Worldwide Ltd.

Dogma' 25th Anniversary Screening (One Night Only!)
Experience a cinematic resurrection! Join us for a special one-night-only screening of Kevin Smith's legendary 1999 comedy, Dogma, in honor of its 25th anniversary.

Long unavailable on streaming platforms and difficult to find on physical media, this cult classic is returning to the big screen. This is a must-see event for 90s movie fans, Gen X and Millennials who grew up on the View Askewniverse, and pop culture enthusiasts looking for a rare theatrical experience.

Featuring an incredible cast including Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Alan Rickman, Chris Rock, and of course, Jay & Silent Bob, Dogma is a bold, hilarious, and thought-provoking satire.

This exclusive showing is part of the Dogma Resurrection Tour hosted by Iconic Events. Donâ€™t miss your chance to see this film as it was meant to be seen. Tickets are limited, so secure your seat and prepare for a night of irreverent humor and nostalgia.

The Play That Goes Wrong
Get Your Tickets Now for The Play That Goes Wrong at Richey Suncoast Theatre!
Prepare for an unforgettable night of side-splitting laughter! The Tony Award-winning international comedy sensation, The Play That Goes Wrong, is bringing its hilarious mayhem to the Richey Suncoast Theatre. If you're looking for tickets to a comedy show in New Port Richey that promises non-stop laughs, this is it!

Experience the absolute chaos as the Cornley Polytechnic Drama Society attempts to put on a 1920s murder mystery. From collapsing sets and missed cues to hilariously botched lines and actors going off script, every theatrical disaster imaginable unfolds before your eyes. Itâ€™s a masterclass in physical comedy and impeccable comedic timing that will have you roaring with laughter from start to finish.

Why You Can't Miss The Play That Goes Wrong
Critically Acclaimed Comedy: This award-winning play has captivated audiences worldwide with its unique blend of farce, slapstick, and pure comedic genius.

Perfect for All Ages: Whether it's a fun night out with friends or a memorable date night, The Play That Goes Wrong guarantees an evening of pure, unadulterated fun for everyone.

See It Live in New Port Richey: Don't miss your chance to see this global hit right here at the Richey Suncoast Theatre.

Doors open 45 minutes prior to showtime; houses open 30 minutes prior to showtime.

Buy your tickets today for The Play That Goes Wrong at Richey Suncoast Theatre and get ready for a night of uncontrollable laughter. You'll be talking about this side-splitting comedy long after the curtain falls!
